bibl.title: In the matter of James A. Balch on Habeas Corpus Proceedings. Petition for Writ
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

msIdentifier.repository: Washington State Archives, Puget Sound Regional Branch

org.orgName: District Court of the Third Judicial District of Washington

div1.p: To the Hon. Richard A. Jones Chief Justice of Washington Territory

Your Petitioner James A. Balch respectfully represents unto your honor First that he is a citizen of the United States of the age of 62 years and was during the war of the Rebellion Second Lieutenant of company F of the First Regiment of Oregon Volunteer as of the state of Oregon that he is unlawfully restrained of his liberty by Dr. J W. Waughop the manager or director of the insane assylum at Steillacoom in the County of Pierce W.T.
Second. That the cause or pretense of this restraint according to the best of the knowledge and belief of your petitioner is an order of the probate

Court of the County of Yakima County Wash. Ter. made and dated on or about the twenty fifth day of May 1883 on account of insanity or alleged insanity on the subject of Religion and incorporation and homocidal tendencies
Third. That if your petitioner were insane at the times or date of said order he has succesfully recovered, and is now and for a long time has been purportly sane and of sound mind

Your petitioner asks that a Writ of Habeas Corpus may be issued requiring the said Dr. J.W. Waughop to produce the body of your petitioner before your honor for the purposes of having his mental condition inquired into and that such under may be made in the Honorable Court of Chief Justice Jones and further you Humble pettione is very weary on this unecessary restaint and incarceration and your petitoner earnestly hopes that your petitions case may have your careful and earnest attention

I cannot believe that I am am a proper object of charity my feelings Rebell against it all the time I have all my life tried to do my duty quietly and now I leave the matter with you. I shall await with great anxiety the summons to appear before your Honorable Court and I believe you are a just judge and will do on the as justice and equity may inquire, and your petitioner as in duty bound will ever pray & Stevenson Witness James a Balch.
Territory of Washington County of Pierce} ss.
James A Balch being first duly sworn deposes and says, he has made the foregoing petition signed by him and he knows the contents thereof and that the same matters and things therein stated are true
Subscribed and sworn to before me this 12th day of May 1888
James M. Stevenson Justice of the Peace
Petition of J.A. Balch for Writ of Habeas Corpus
Let a writ of Habeas Corpus issue on filing this petition - returnable June 5 1888 at 1:30 o'clock p.m. of that day at my chambers in Seattle, W.T.
FILED JUN 1 1888 W E Ledgerwoood Clerk. By H T Harmon Deputy Clerk.
